title.narrative: WASH ENABLING ENVIRONMENT

description.narrative: The government and other key stakeholders have an improved capacity to legislate, coordinate, plan and monitor Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services, which contributes to Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Environmental Sustainability, Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children and women in vulnerable regions use drinking water points and sanitation facilities and adopt good hygiene practices, including in emergency situations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The government and other key stakeholders have an improved capacity to legislate, coordinate, plan and monitor WASH services

description.narrative: Despite the COVID-19 pandemic that imposes a slowdown in some of the interventions regarding sector strengthening, other capacity-building actions have nevertheless been implemented. These interventions target especially Ministry of water and Energy staff at the national and regional level as well as municipalities. These interventions cover quality control of water and sanitation works but also infection prevention control, and cholera preparedness. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:01/02/2022
